Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reviewing the administration for children’s services maintenance of health records for youth in the juvenile justice system
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Reviewing the administration for children’s services maintenance of health records for youth in the juvenile justice system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign a law amending article 45 of the Civil Practice Law and Rules to prohibit juvenile admissions and statements against penal interest made during court-ordered mental health screening and treatment from being admitted into evidence in subsequent criminal proceedings
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Prohibit juvenile admissions and statements against penal interest made during court-ordered mental health screening and treatment from being admitted into evidence in subsequent criminal proceedings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to clarifying who can visit youth in secure detention facilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Clarifying who can visit youth in secure detention facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the administration for children’s services to provide video conferencing for youth in secure detention facilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the administration for children’s services to provide video conferencing for youth in secure detention facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Administration for Children’s Services to permit youth in detention facilities to request privacy during visits and phone calls
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring ACS to permit youth in detention facilities to request privacy during visits and phone calls.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reviewing the administration for children’s services maintenance of health records for youth in the juvenile justice system
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee

Items.MatterName: Requiring the administration for children’s services to provide video conferencing for youth in secure detention facilities.
